x9FYW2WT0HDh5ivTd0AyHw.text: I've been to Pan Asian, one of the few Chinese/Japanese/Thai(?) places nearby.  I was looking to see how this place compared.  So, a couple quick pluses noted right away: it was smaller and more intimate, and while there were a few TVs mounted on the walls, I didn't hear them.  I could hear Asian music.  That was good--I was in a mood for quiet.  But as I waited this Sunday night to be seated, several minutes went by and no one greeted me.  And they weren't that crowded.  Finally a young man came over to seat me.  He didn't smile, barely made eye contact, and seemed more interested in watching the TV than in seating me.  And it wasn't like it was the World Series on!  So I'm seated at a quiet booth and get dinner and drink menus.  The waitress comes shortly to take my drink order.  Very nice.  No beer on tap though--only bottles.  I head to the restroom and get assailed by a smell that smells like it was backed up to a sewer pipe. And all they have is a little air freshener device.  I don't think it's going to do it, folks.  I go back and select everything off the Japanese menu.  I order miso soup.  There a wide variety of traditional sushi rolls and some "nouveau" stuff, like the cream cheese in rolls and so forth.  I ordered a few different rolls.  The miso soup was good, with plenty of big pieces of nori.  The various rolls were well-wrapped.  Tasty, nothing particularly artistic about them.  The most interesting was one with mango on top with some sauce, that was very colorful and flavorful.  The server came around a couple times to see how things were.  So--Pan Asian may be a bit more noisy and big, but it's classier and seems cleaner and the waitstaff are more pleasant.  Seeing as they're both near each other, I'd go back there, not here

eFTFLhAxmAFieur-c4s55w.text: Good food! I won't discount that, but when you have food delivered you kinda should bring condiments with you. I ordered sushi and there was no wasabi and ginger :-( and I really wanted the spice today. The killer roll is good on the sushi menu and I love their beef and broccoli!!!

cLEEnnWmRdU9fgL-PoBF3g.text: Everything at this restaurant is delicious. I had miso soup, spicy crab salad, and sushi. It was all delicious. I usually come around dinner time. I've always been happy with the service as well. I highly recommend this restaurant.

PY0rtZbXtZrxt8jGK1iWrQ.text: A friend told us about this place a year ago when we moved into the area from Mesa. Today we finally got around to trying it. After trying a little takeout place in the area I was scared to try any other Asian food near here. This whole year I have been making excuses to go back into Mesa/Tempe for my old favorites, Ninja and Pong Pongs.  I liked the interior. The patio was very well decorated but it was still just a tad too warm to sit outside. Really liked the plates and salt shakers too. Anyways, I was there for food,and the place was clean and visually pleasing. More than good enough for me.  I can't complain about the service. We were seated right away. The waitress was pleasant and stopped to take our order 3 times before we could decide what we wanted. Our glasses were always full and I didn't feel like we waited too long for anything at any point.  The crab rangoon was great. I wanted to try some soup but actually forgot to order any...  I normally judge a new place by ordering my favorite, Kung Pao Chicken. This time I was in the mood for something sweet and ordered the Sweet & Sour Chicken. I have to say, it was great. The chicken was tender and not chewy. The batter was crispy and the sauce was perfect (for my tastes).  My lunch companion had the Shrimp Egg Foo Yung and I managed to steal a taste. I've never had Egg Foo Yung before and it was great. I'm going to have to get it for myself on a future trip. I'm a very texture-based eater and I love water chestnuts (crunchy and moist) and mushrooms and the Egg Foo Yung had plenty of both.  Overall, Sun Asian Kitchen was an extremely pleasant surprise. I am so happy to have found such a good place with good food in this area. I cannot wait to go again and try something else from the menu.

llWsT4s6z34-oFH569EDhg.text: My sister and I come here all the time for sushi. Every visit was left with a full palette and happy smiles. Its really hard to find a good sushi joint around Phoenix and this place does the job. The staff is always friendly and welcoming. Happy hour prices are amazing. Especially if your a big sushi eater the happy hour is a great time to show up. Never had anything on the menu that was disappointing yet. If you dont feel like eating sushi this place also has a Chinese menu.

b2_Z3VArLxKTBzbeIG40Sg.text: I have been going to lunch here for years almost once a week. The staff is very polite and the food is amazing. If I am lucky I always have the same waitress which know what i like and gets my order in quickly.  I have never had a bad experience here, the food is very reasonably priced. kLuhiq5JUkc0kFj6nIm3gQ.text: I am a fan of this place, but only because this is the only place around to eat decent sushi. i used to go to Pan Asia which was down the road from this place but they shut down :( My experiences here aren't too bad. The place is clean, and always packed during lunch. A huge + is that they deliver on orders over $20 or $25.  Their portions and taste of the food are good. I tend to get the Twice Cooked Pork lunch which comes with fried rice and an egg roll. I must admit I always order that and sometimes sushi. The lunch combo is like $6.99 so it's not bad for what you get. I am giving this 3 stars for one reason only. The service and attitude of the workers. When I walk in of I am greeted and promptly my group and I are seated, and they take our drink order. But after that, the attitudes roll downhill. They do not come by and refill your drinks, when you flag someone down to ask for a refill they give this "don't f'en talk to me look", when they do come by they set your drink down hard and walk away. They are quick to give you your bill and walk away, not asking if you want anything else.  This last time I went on 11/14/2014 during the lunch rush, my co-worker ordered water as her beverage. The employee sat our drinks down, but they added lemon to her water. When trying to explain that she was allergic to lemon, that same employee looked like she didn't understand and gave one of the most bitchiest looks I have seen. I recommend take out or delivery during the lunch rush.

KUH1OOVFPoAqe6cxt7JV3w.text: One of the better places in town to eat sushi. Service is a little slow sometimes but prices are reasonable.

Nfo4EKanw6syO_MMSWikvQ.text: Really good! My husband is Korean and this is his favorite place to go in the Phoenix area. Definitely recommend :)

ggkkLLMWJ_2GbyMsL5g5Uw.text: Huge portions, place seemed a little weird but the food was excellent! Had the sesame chicken and it's the best I've tasted. Will come back but I rarely eat Chinese!

NIe6_H503UaySKo_qF7c8w.text: Absolutely delicious food at fantastic prices! The lunch special is a great deal, they give you plenty of food for under 7 bucks. I would recommend it to anyone looking for a nice sit down Chinese meal!

photos.caption: Photo of Sun Asian Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ZhrQ1-3mvel5Kdkaaxs3Og.text: I work down the street so this is my go-to place for Chinese food during lunch. I often call the order in at 10:50am and it's done and ready for pickup by 11:05. Their lunch menu is cheap and they have so many options and flavors are on point! I always get the lemon chicken with fried rice lunch combo, which comes with a veggie egg roll. The portion size is very generous, and I always pick it up piping hot and fresh. Some Chinese restaurants will make lemon chicken with overly breaded chicken, but this place uses real chunks of chicken and is lightly breaded, so when you take a bite, you see a big piece of chicken and not all fried breading. The lemon sauce is perfectly sweet, tangy, sour, just the way it should be. The fried rice is good and not too greasy. The veggie egg roll is a nice size and comes with sweet and sour sauce which is always good! For less than $7 bucks, this place is definitely a winner!

HmW6m3UivTvPVrqD9AEXqg.text: I write this review with tremendous disappointment. I've gone to this restaurant and loved it for years. Tonight I had orange chicken to tasted like fish. I called them to voice my complaint they offered to replace it. I drove back up there and found they didn't even start to cook the replacement. They haggled over replacing the rice too. They acted like they didn't care  at all. When thwy finally replaced it and then the second batch tasted like fish also. I called to talk to a manager. He didn't care, talked over me the whole time on the phone. He asked if I wanted to come get my money. I didn't feel like driving for a third time. I said no, I was going to offer he give me a credit for next time. Instead, before I got the chance to say it, he hung up on me. I am done. I will never go back again.

cm5ZSESxVD0cYGXRj3nvpg.text: Sun Asian Kitchen was a nice little place. Modern looking, yet had a definite Asian-owned feel. No loud music, had some TVs and a bar. My friend and I ordered the chicken egg rolls (eggzcellent) the fish fillet with black bean sauce (a little salty, but to be expected with black bean sauce), and the lemon pepper chicken (which didn't have that strong of a lemon flavor, but still good). This place definitely surprised us. We wanted to try it for a while. I definitely recommend it.

uZkYkpr77jnqJ4LjBR6lvg.text: This fusion restaurant is a must visit. Hey, there's actual Asians working in that kitchen! Strange! The service used to be fairly robotic, but they have dialed it in over the years. This is the only restaurant that we have ever frequented that we actually ordered more food when we were full just so we could have leftovers. Their hot and sour soup is the best in the universe. The residual heat from it has staying power. The squid salad is so good that it makes me want to cry. I wish that I had a refrigerator full of their egg rolls. I could eat those every day of the week. The honey chicken is my friend. I still think that it is bizarre that there are Egyptian hieroglyphics decorating the walls but I hope that never changes!

My dining partners have tasted the fish which I am told was great. I have only been here during lunch. They offer some reasonable and filling lunch specials. Defiantly a place I would recommend.

pR4QrK7Ep4rrj4e6xQGJUQ.text: I would give this a lower star if possible, a friend of mine took me here once and it was fairly enjoyable so I decided to take my best friend here. First time we came there was an extremely loud argument with one of their customers and instead of trying to defuse the situation the employees egg them on and make matters worse with threats of violence and calling the police. The second time I didn't appreciate the service so I didn't want to leave a tip so the waitress decided to guilt me into leaving one and even showed me how much I should be leaving. The food wasn't that good to begin with, the rice was dry, burnt, and all around flavorless; and on top of everything it felt as though the waitress was trying to get rid of us as soon as we got there. I've worked in the food industry before so I know how stressful and draining It can be but this was just terrible all around and I definitely won't be coming back. Also found multiple black spots in my food and I had no idea what they were and there was a cockroach maybe five yards away from our table, honestly looked as though they tried to hide it.

YhLL6Myje1JTBbc-m8YL_A.text: I was in the mood for some Sushi so checked out this restaurant on a Thursday evening. It wasn't too busy but not too quiet either. We were sat right away by a window and ordered the following: Age Tofu (delicious), Crab Rangoon had no crab (literally just cream cheese), Pad Thai (it was a good entree but not really pad thai due to no flavors of peanut dressing, lime, or fish sauce. It also contained peppers and onions but no bean sprouts. I ordered the Las Vegas roll which was excellent btw and although I didn't plan on ordering desert it would've been nice to have been asked. I guess our waitress wanted us out asap even though it wasn't close to closing time yet. I could tell she was in a hurry when she brought the check over along with a to-go box we'd asked for and the fortune cookies. She proceeded to hang out really close and asked twice if we were ready. So, if you want to chat after your meal I guess hurry up and pay first! LOL Overall the food was OK to great depending on what you order and the service was just OK. We'll come back because they had good sushi and there is nothing closer to us for sushi, otherwise we'd probably skip Sun Asian in the future.

uLYe9o-YrtHJ4Z3Ti5R5Nw.text: Listen up people!!!!! Our waiter took our order at the register across from the bar, he seemed it a hurry during a 3:00 pm down time, not sure what that was all about. Then when the food came our wrong, he made it seem like it was my fault. It sucked

SbnL5r6DP5GpGq_562X5MQ.text: Been here several times and got excellent service but for some reason sitting outside causes the wait staff to forget you. I ordered a Long Island ice tea and then told them to wait until happy hour to bring me my next one which was about half a hour. A hour later and the drink never came so when the waitress finally showed up I just asked for her to split the check and not to bring me the drink. She can back with the drink a half hour later and I told her I didn't wanted it. We just wanted to leave because we were sitting there for two hours already. She comped the drink then brought back the tab which was also not split. The food was very good but the wait staff needs to be more attentive. This place wasn't busy so not sure why it was so difficult to check on the patio table area.

zxBOe2yl-mHu-A8Xpiw2XA.text: Alright - I am going to update this review because Sun Asian Kitchen is a frequent stop for me.  No it's not the best (Chinese) food I have ever eaten. But their sushi is pretty darn great, plus they have a bar, iced mochas (not joking), Americanized Food items, and they deliver.  I recently just got their Sushi Salad (Tuna, White Tuna, Mango, Avocado, crisp lettuce, shredded carrots, cherry tomatoes and a spicy sweet sauce) and it was heaven. I am updating my review just because of this.  I gotta give them props, since they're in South Phoenix. We're lucky they exist out here.  You keep up the good fight Sun Asian Kitchen, and I'll ordering delivery from you (since it's hot and I am too lazy to drive).  Recommended:  Happy Hour - It's cheap Drinks - Fun times Delivery - Awesome convenience Sushi - Pretty tasty  Not: The Chinese Food (unless you do like Americanized Chinese Food)

IVbEQyDkq2RNODqQ1ZE9xw.text: Just got back from having lunch here...  Been many times in the last year for lunch, take out, ect.  We will NOT be back!!!  Went for lunch... got my usual of kung pao tofu with white rice and veggie egg roll.  My husband ordered 2 pc. tuna nigiri, 2 pc. salmon nigiri, 2 pc. yellowtail nigiri.  The reason he ordered this is because walking in there was a big dry erase board above the sushi chef and it said, "Daily special  Nigiri 99 cent/ 1 pc.  Yellowtail $1.50/ 1 pc."  When we ordered we specified that he was getting the daily special and how many of each kind.    When we got the bill he was charged $16 for 6 pc of sushi when it should have been $7.  When I pointed out the mistake I was told that the white board special is happy hour specials.  I pointed out that no where on the white board did it specify that there was a time that the specials were good for.  I also pointed out that it was specified at the time of order that we were getting the daily special and pointed with my finger to the white board.  The woman still charged us the $16.  She got a $0 tip.  Well Sun Asian, you just lost a big local customer.  You will never see us again.

4yhUtFa6cjj1RqnbdL0xew.text: The mongolian beef was delicious, the Kung Pao chicken a bit less but the restaurant has good food overall, 4 stars.

zLC8Likm2-pYJ-S2YYD6og.text: Came here during lunch and it was busy. It did not take long to get seated, but before, my party and I looked at the menus. h_xkNt5OOSGzgKzHnzcoHw.text: Worst service and food ever!! I'm a server myself and I know Asians are slow but that service was rediculous I didn't see my server besides when she took my order and dropped off my food.  Besides the service the food was aweful!!!! I was so excited for my sushi which was fine... but it was suppose to come out before the rest of my food.. which it didnt. So I had a few piece and decided to try my teriyaki chicken DO NOT EAT! first bite tasted hard and for some reason like an uncooked piece of broccoli had to spit it out. The fried rice was very good too.  The sushi roll was on the small side for $8.25.  Everything was tasty and we had leftovers.

_4NII6VOuKVIpDLkqYSq-A.text: Sun Asia is not a 5-Star restaurant, but for what it is, I give it 5 stars.   They have probably the best happy hour I have ever seen that lasts from 3pm-7pm then 9pm-Close, and is SEVEN DAYS A WEEK. The HH menu includes single pieces of sushi for $0.99, rolls for $3, and a variety of other fried appetizers for a few bucks (including fried tofu and vegetable dumplings that are vegan friendly) in addition to a ton of cheap ass booze. You can get a sake bomber with Kirin/Kirin Light for $3.85. Beers (domestic and import) are under $2, cocktails are $5, and they even have scorpion bowls!  The staff has been very friendly and quick to answer questions, and the service is always quick.   The decor is totally funky inside, which I personally like. it has a lot of character. They also have a really nice patio that is great for beautiful days and day drinking!  Their regular menu is really expansive and I've only had the kung pao tofu, but it was really good.   They have free delivery with a $25 minimum, but only specific hours. M-F 11a-3p/5p-8p and Sat/Sun 12-8p. You can fax or email your order in too, which I think is pretty cool. Delivery is from 16th ave - 48th street, Broadway to Dobbins.   Thank god we have Sun Asia because there is practically nothing else in South Phoenix. Definitely hit this place up if you are in the area!!!

Ptf88ObhRbbEj2ZcNNA2VQ.text: I am going with 5 stars May my server was awsome . She took my order corectly, gave feed back when I asked her what was best and followed up quickly with a check and to go box. 40V_mrP1nOcGVnh6VoVKmA.text: My boyfriend and I go here probably once a week.  From the outside, it looks terribly dodgy, but on the inside the restaurant is quite lovely.  The owners have obviously invested considerable capital in this place, getting custom-made metal work, etc.  Our first visit: Sweet and sour chicken - what I order whenever I'm trying a new Chinese restaurant - isn't awesome, but it was good enough to make me come back.  My boyfriend got a beef dish; his only complaint was that there was too much meat and not enough vegetables.    The chicken skewers appetizers are soso, but the dumplings are very tasty.  Recommend pan-fried over steamed, though either are yummy.   I rarely stray from the almond chicken.  It is the perfect dish, with the chicken & veggies (zuchinni, mushrooms, water chestnuts, onions & peppers) in perfect proportion, all in delicious brown sauce that has just enough ginger to be perfectly palate-cleansing (instead of cloying, as some brown sauces can be).  The almonds, toasted, are a great additional 'crunch' in the dish.  Other dishes we've had: string bean beef and chicken are two of my boyfriend's favorites.  Chicken & vegetables are yummy, as is the double cooked (or double fried) chicken.  My mother, when she visited, had egg foo yung with beef and thought it was awesome.    Service is exceptional.  They're always happy to provide a pitcher of water when I ask for it, and if I forget to ask, my glass doesn't ever stay empty for long.

p-fLM6Gh_M3CgKNG1YkjSQ.text: YUCK! ick! ewwwww! would be how I'd describe my lunch at Sun Asian Kitchen. Whatever was served was albeit presentable but in terms of taste not good at all. I ordered the wonton soup and the Honey Chicken combo (comes with a chicken eggroll, and choice of fried rice, steamed rice or lo mein, brown rice is extra). The wonton soup had a weird taste to it, the broth was alright and the vegetables included in the soup canned. The Honey Chicken combo arrived shortly after, and it looked promising. And what goodness it seemed to offer ended after the first bite. I know how to cook fried rice, and yes, fried rice is made with day old rice but what I had was the rice at the bottom of the pan, there were hard bits to it that would stick to my teeth and there was no flavor to it, as for flavor, the honey chicken had nothing close to it being honey chicken, and the dish tasted off. It was a mess. I was hoping to at least enjoy the chicken minus the lackluster fried rice but the fried pieces of chicken was mostly batter and less chicken. And the sauce was just too sweet and thick that I really didn't know what I was eating hence I just stopped eating and considered my lunch a loss. =( I agree with a yelper that sun asian kitchen is a step above fast food but if I were to compare this tragedy with Panda Express, I'd take Panda over this hot mess. Overall my experience at Sun Asian Kitchen was bad sauce, and wouldn't recommend this place to anyone at all. I'm sorry Sun Asian Kitchen, you're a bad news bear. =(

5yT7eqh7XGZE8VwdLNap1w.text: Ok. A full star is generous but this site only allows 1 star increments. I've been to this place 3 times, hoping that service will either improve or balance out. I like to support "mom and pop" places and local restaurants which is why I gave it several opportunities to make up for poor service. But to my disappointment, this is the last straw. I show up for a bite to eat with a friend around 9pm on a Monday night which is typically the slowest night of the week for most restaurants. As soon as we received our menus we were already expected to give our order. After asking for a few more minutes to decide, the waitress comes back in less than a minute, urging us to make a decision. Strike 1. Next after ordering our food, we receive our orders in a reasonable amount of time. By now it's about 9:15. The food is mediocre as usual but that can be forgiven to a certain degree. While I'm still eating the last few bites of my food, the waitress is tugging at my plate to take it away. I had to stop her and tell her that I wasn't quite finished. Strike 2. She came back a couple of minutes later dropped off the check and packed the few leftovers. By now it's around 9:30. My friend and I were in the middle of a conversation when she rudely interrupted to ask to close the check. I glanced at my watch to be mindful of the time they close which was 10pm...it was 9:35. Strike 3. At this point, enough is enough. I asked for a manager to let her know of the poor service and I was suddenly surrounded by the remaining wait staff which stood there waiting for me to act crazy or something. After politely speaking my dissatisfaction, my friend and I left vowing never to return and encourage others to do the same. In this economic climate, you would think that frequent customers would save establishments like this. However, to create frequent customers, they would have to be encouraged to come back!! I am amazed how this place stays in business. Mediocre food (at best), rather high prices, and poor service. If you want to pour money into local businesses, pour it somewhere else because this establishment could care less.

7y_q_e57buqZ3MCgcyuDfQ.text: Ok, I rarely give establishments one star, especially not when I initially gave the place three stars or above. I will have to make an exception for Sun Asian Kitchen. The first time my husband and I went there (the experience I based my first review on), the food definitely wasn't outstanding or authentic, but it was decent. The fact that it was the only non-hole-in-the-wall Asian place in South Phoenix also made me settle on a solid three stars.   Last night, on my way back from Tucson, my husband called in an order and I went to pick it up. We got the crab wontons, chicken chow fun, and Mongolian beef. When I got home with the food (after waiting 10 extra minutes for the food to be ready), we sat down to eat, ready for some standard but satisfying Chinese.   Well, we were in for a big disappointment. The food was awful, literally disgusting. To start with, the chicken in the chow fun was literally formed and the farthest thing from breast you can get - my husband said it reminded him of the way the chicken meat in McNuggets used to be before they upgraded to all white meat. I figure if McDonalds can make the switch, so can this place. I picked out all the chicken, hoping that the chow fun would at least be decent, but it was super-oily, so much so it was almost inedible. The crab wontons had literally two flecks of artificial crab in them and were basically stuffed with straight cream cheese. Not good. The beef was also terrible quality, the only saving grace of the dish being the flavorful sauce and scallions. We both felt really sick after the little we did eat and wished that we had taken our $25 and gone to Panda Express instead. Yeah, it was that bad.   The biggest irony of all is that the restaurant actually claims that they use top-quality meat. On their website, they state that they only use  "top quality meat, seafood  and  the  freshest  garden vegetables to cook your food  to ensure  an authentic and memorable eating experience." Yeah. Right. I know there's a recession going on, but serving meat worse than McDonald's is inexcusable and will certainly keep us from spending our valuable food dollars there. A place called Pan Asia (advertises itself is having sushi and Chinese fusion) is about to open up across the street (24th and Baseline) in the center; it will be exciting to have another Asian restaurant in South Phoenix to choose from, and I hope that the competition will force Sun Asian Kitchen to live up to their own promise to use only the highest-quality ingredients.

ysiE7QG-G3DsFF_HtTtc4g.text: I typically get the crispy honey chicken from here along with white rice and a chicken egg roll. I have yet to be disappointed and consider it a good alternative from the Panda Express down the street. QmkIJOl9396znaAw5cxS0g.text: My work has ordered from this place on a couple occassions.  I thought the food was pretty good. JwO_7W6rgNxn5EdLF9SGlg.text: There are very few places in this area that deliver. Sun Asian kitchen claims that you can send in an e-mail order for delivery. I did so tonight at 5pm. At 6pm I decided to call and see why the order was held up. They said they don't check e-mail often and that it would be another 20 minutes. An hour later, they called and asked if I still wanted my food. At 7:30 (2.5 hours after I placed my order), the food finally got here. I called and talked to the woman, and she fought with me on the phone and blamed the situation on me for saying after 2 hours that I still wanted my food. Go down the street to PanAsia. dA7A7yExPWxOqnU3AAXibQ.text: This review is only of the sushi menu as I have never ordered anything off the regular menu.  This place has awesome happy hour and reverse happy hour specials. $2 Sapporo and Kirin, 99 cent nigiri and $4 rolls. I'm not going to lie to you, this is not sushi for sushi snobs, and I have sushi snob friends that refuse to go here. But if you're not...I have eaten here over a dozen times and only 1 visit was the fish a little under par. The service is quite good and the sushi comes out pretty fast.   The restaurant itself is cute and well decorated with a nice ambiance. It is nice to have a place like this in South Phoenix with cheaper prices (and WAY better music) than the place down the road.

m1SHgcdp3EnxIzg6kE6a0w.text: Lunch Menu is awesome! Happy hour specials are cheap! I'm here probably once every two weeks. I love sushi.

yIuRw1r5ry8CVNhz9b5JUA.text: The food is amazing and staff is great! One of my favorite restaurants by far! Food is reasonably priced and they have a wide selection of appetizers, entrees, sushi, soups, and deserts. I have dinned in, ordered take out, and have had several home deliveries. Sun Asian Kitchen has never disappointed me and has always lived up to my expectations!

lCI2WPfMu4HjjuAFL-mwQQ.text: We're all clear that wanting to like something is not the same as liking it, right? Well, I want to love this place. It's the closest non-take out Chinese food place to my house so I was completely ready to make this "My Chinese Restaurant". Unfortunately it doesn't quite live up to the hype. It is all good. It's fine. Some parts better than others. Entrees are in the $8 range for chicken/beef dishes, in the $16 range for seafood and they offer a few specialty dishes up to the early $20's. They have a decent section of vegetarian things as well, but less than you might expect at a Chinese restaurant. There was more "sweet" in the sesame chicken than in the Orange chicken - and they looked far too much like the same thing. The interior is kinda cool with funky lamps, window hangings and lots of bamboo. For a spot that size the bar, where you can also sit and eat, is a bit too big for me - but just because those 2 big screen tv's are pointing out to the rest of the restaurant so we can't help but be reminded it's there. The service? Not so bueno. I've been there 3 times and once it was good, but not great. The other times have been pretty off each time. I read a great review about the place by a professional reviewer claiming that it was similar to San Francisco Chinese food fare. I'm guessing he's wrong, but I wanted to put it out here for other folks to see. somonews.com/article.cfm... I'd love to hear what you Bay area transplants have to say...

b7SoAzPtge4tAUu-chAf9A.text: We're not in New York or San Francisco, two cities where I've lived, so the chinese food isn't going to be spectacular.  However, when you need your chinese fix, or don't feel like making dinner, Sun Asian has quality chinese food at a decent price.  Plus, they deliver now!

1OyWrUuV-B8nwSRUGilDvA.text: There's some harsh reviews of this place but I don't have an issue with it really. Price is normal for dinner places, the staff are not the nicest people out there but if you sit and eat they are nice and quick with soda/tea refills and removing plates.  They have a happy hour (I think it's every day) from 4-7 where all their appetizers (lots of em) are half off.  If I get there before 7, which I try to, I usually only order a bunch of different appetizers so I have like 4-5 different things to eat... I like it.  Their orange chicken is bomb too!

Ve0Kq2O9Uc1su-OcNT7ZQg.text: A friend of mine invited me to this place for lunch yesterday and I was a bit skeptical at first. After a moment of deliberation, I decided to break free from my regular lunch spots and try something new.  There was a small line to be seated so the hostess asked us if we wanted to sit outside instead of waiting for a spot inside. We accepted her offer and were seated immediately. As soon as I sat in my chair my server was there with menus, ready to take drink orders. She brought us both glasses of water as requested and also brought a pitcher for us to refill with (nice touch as I hate waiting for refills on water).  We both placed our orders off of the very well priced lunch menu and waited less than 10 minutes for our food. Everything came out exactly as ordered and tasted great!   We were in and out of there in less than 30 minutes which is quite rare for a sit-down restaurant during busy lunch times. I was impressed with the service, speed and price at Sun Asian Kitchen and I recommend this place to anyone looking for a good meal at a good price without wasting your entire lunch hour.

YTyPCzRyMawXIOaafKNCUA.text: LOVE this place.. the food is always good and the happy hour prices make it very affordable to get sushi and the appetizers only and leave happy with the final bill! The Miso soup is WONDERFUL and the sushi is actually very good with a good selection as well!   I was not happy one time with an item and they were quick to fix it and took it off my bill too!   I could eat here every night but we live too far away!!

Y45swHGf8JEjsJLcP-i6hQ.text: This place is awesome! The atmosphere is so relaxing and the service was great! I had the rainbow roll and really liked it, and the prices were very reasonable. I will definitely be coming back!

LzgGAHQ-3J_FW6xKorFJVw.text: I went to have lunch here last week and couldn't believe how fast, inexpensive and friendly there were! I had veggie lo main and it was very tasty. I recommend this to anyone looking for a quick dellish lunch.

9add2VSv_tgl5D1vBb5Keg.text: Sun Asian has an eclectic decor that makes me think of what would happen if a foreign tourist had dinner once in a PF Changs, then tried to re-create it from memory a decade later. It attempts to be trendy but ends up looking like a loft apartment that was well-decorated, then occupied by someone's grandmother who didn't have the best taste. It is at least open and airy, though.  It is a semi-regular lunch spot for me and my co-workers, since it is really easy to get tired of going to Chipotle over and over on the corner of 24th and Baseline, and I refuse to go to Ono Hawaiian Grill. Yuck.  The staff is generally friendly and chipper, if a bit too informal. On a couple of occasions I have had to wait a while to be greeted at my table, but 90% of the time it is a quick in and out lunch.  The food is average-to-decent chinese fare with average sushi and a couple of other asian cuisines thrown in. It is nothing earth-shattering, but it is reliably decent.  I always order the veggies in garlic sauce, but substitute crispy fried tofu. The fried tofu is always well-seasoned and cooked just right. The rice is, let's be honest, mediocre shopping center chinese restaurant rice, but it is perfectly acceptable.  It is a great place to grab lunch for 7 or 8 bucks.

B-Jb3wj6xkSJ-hl2L9JSHQ.text: The food is a little pricey, but not to bad. I have been twice to this place and the have really good food, clean and airy with pretty good service. I will continue to go back. I have never been for dinner so I gate rate the service or vibe at dinner time.

HMhlfxqRv9v16N9o_IOE7g.text: we ate here for dinner.  there were 3 adults.  i had the cashew chicken, my wife ordered the chicken with mixed vegetables and my brother ordered sushi rolls ( i don't eat sushi so i don't know exactly what rolls were ordered).  the food was just okay.  it was not bad or great.  we felt okay about it because the prices were reasonable.  the service was great.  the service met all our needs and even tried to tend to our 2 year old son.  that was kinda cool.  this place is not a favorite but we don't mind going back for something average, quick, and with great service.

jJ0xs7iODmqwaT77TcPozg.text: If you work in the Sky Harbor area and want a hot, sit down, full lunch with drink for less than $10 that includes the tip than this place is it! Their lunch specials are under $6 and very filling. All your favorite dishes! Meal comes with egg roll and rice and it's a pretty harty portion. My husband loves this place too, wish it was close to my house.

snpY4YgDWnDsS04xjiPLTQ.text: WORST SERVICE EVER! Waited over 45 minutes for a drink!  Several delays in food/drink throughout the 2 1/2 hour visit. When I approached the waitress she was VERY rude and said, "You want me to apologize for not serving you?" Well, yes, as service provider, you should apologize for the lack of service.  We asked 3 times for our check, which took over 30 minutes to get.  It had the drinks on it that we never got.  We asked to talk to the manager 3 times and never had a response.  When I walked up to the bar to talk to the manager, she was also not apologetic and said they were just busy.  They were not that busy and even if they were, they still could apologize for the lack of service.  No apology from anyone, in fact, got attitude from all servers and manager.  So much, that when they brought my card and receipt back to me, the waitress literally threw my card and receipt at me!!!!! Can you believe that? She obviously has never had waitress/customer service etiquette 101. So completely rude of all staff members. Walked out so frustrated because I never got an apology for being at the restaurant for over 2 1/2 hours for a simple meal. Ridiculous. Will not go back.

mp-Qeo6ERwpzmNTTVBqtIw.text: This place has a good happy hour. The food is not the best but it is pretty decent. Service is fair

ImSPJYpeNkzK_oJrUMYeeQ.text: I love this place. It's clean, nice, and the food is great. They have happy hour and are inexpensive when it's not happy hour. My favorite is the crispy honey chicken and their egg rolls. Their sushi is yummy too. They have decently priced drinks with quick and attentive service. My only complaint is that when they are super busy there is one server in particular that seems  unfriendly. We frequent this place at least once a month. I would recommend this place to people who are looking for a place that is inexpensive, casual yet nicer than your typical family restaurant, and tasty with a good variety.

WNHl8YYsKn-m15z3wtHxfQ.text: The food is very good and the prices off the lunch menu are quite cheap.  The portion size is about right for lunch and I was able to get an entree with rice and an egg roll and a drink for about $10 including tip.

6OXRb9AYqYu1UFMWQH2w5g.text: I went there when I drove around to find something good for lunch. I had the Teriyaki pork and a smoothie. I think that the price/value doesn't compare to other good Chinese places. Not sure how the other food on the menu is, but the Teriyaki pork is not worth dropping in. It also took quite a while to get the food.

cYVmrkYqHFBWFEEzFXSbww.text: OK, I HAVE to give this place 5 stars because they server THE BEST Chinese food I have ever had.  Their sushi is mediocre, and so is their service, but their food is brilliant.  Every piece of meat was tender, their shrimp was well cleaned and cooked, and high quality to begin with.  I am definitely going back, I just might get take out next time...

8HXIEO3t8eOYKNj7NF0rhw.text: Love our neighborhood Chinese restaurant!  We are never disappointed.  May often waits on us and she is quick, efficient and very friendly.  I have never had a dish I didn't like.  Great prices and large portions.

r1y1P_SGv9JJ0j35Os6TEg.text: Tony is a great example of a good owner he is friendly hard working and maintains a great restaurant. Mongolian beef is delicious and they have great sake homer specials and it seems like it's always happy hour. It has been a welcome place to come relax after work and get good food with cheap drinks. Make sure to stop by or order out either way you will receive great service!

LFybVulCsN8zzlTN2WMDbQ.text: So why would you have on your menus that you offer free delivery on orders of $25 more when in fact you charge? Seems misleading at best. So I called to get delivery and order over $25 and the person that answers the phone says they charge for delivery even over $25. So I asked is this  something new? She replied we do it sometimes. So why on my order when I'm less than a mile away?  Crazy. All I ask is for Restaurants is to honor what they advertise.

photos.caption: Photo of Sun Asian Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

GXWDmqs5X5nYKIRxX6QrrA.text: Just left, not impressed. Horrid service, slow. Asked me if I was ready a minute after seated, and asked 2x for sushi menu. Then they didnt come back... didn't give me a pen to write on the sushi menu. Got my food, it was okay. But then waited for a Sprite  refill for a while. Then waited almost 20 mins for my bill. Saw 2 tables leave that were sat before me! Hen she finally set itdown, she had a mouthful of foods! Yuck! The ladies at the table near me, the waitress argued with them that they didnt water the drink down! As I was waiting, I saw fruit flies land on my plate.. Nope. Wont be back.

Av-NkSjnval9bj9l2L_C5g.text: Great food for the price and love the cashier. I can't remember her name but she always has jokes when I come to pick-up my order.

Pv79_JIvTjz7eeb2Fp-WcQ.text: Nice little find  I  discovered Sun Asian Kitchen when I was searching for a Chinese restaurant in an unfamiliar area .  I thought to myself,  who would know of a good place to grab a quick bite to eat, the answer was simple, my fellow "yelpers" and my fellow "yelpers" were right Sun Asian Kitchen was a nice little find.  From the time we entered the restaurant and received a warm welcome to the "Please come again" as we left out experience was very pleasant. The menu offers a wide choice of dishes wuch includes lunch and dinner specials.  All the food is fresh and excellent tasting, and the portions are large, I mean really large.  You get a great deal for your money! The barbecue pork and noodles, egg rolls, and egg drop soup were really very good.  The service is very fast and friendly. Sun Asian Kitchen has both booths and tables and they have take out.

photos.caption: Photo of Sun Asian Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Sun Asian Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Sun Asian Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

vxG3XDxKhflMeajBccm2cQ.text: Casual Asian restaurant around our neighborhood.  The service can be a hot or miss.   I gotten bad service and other times it's been exceptional.   We always order different foods and it's always been good.  The sushi is decent.  It's kid friendly so it's a plus!   There's a bar to sit, dine in or patio seating.  If you live near by and don't want to drive far this might be a good option.

IPBK4J_eTT7jbTsI9hzMFw.text: The food is great but every now again after 10+ years of going there I have issues with my order. If I'm ordering sweet and sour chicken and I know I have a drive and want my sauce on the side because I don't like soggy food, is asking too much??? I mean I'm speaking $10+ a meal $40+ for entire bill and I drive home just to be disappointed. I called to make them aware of my incorrect order just to be told they're too busy to figure out if the kitchen or the person took the order. I'm just upset because now I just wasted $10 because I hate soggy food!!!! Other than that that food is really great and service has been great. Only one bad experience and two wrong orders in 10+ years is still 4 stars I just hope Tony make it right.

dcRLKLoPP7D7YTToSKyH5w.text: I been coming here since 2015 food is not bad, the plates are so big we tend to share so no complaints there. Although there service has always been awful. They can be rude and they hover over you while you put down the tip and make a comment if its less then they liked. I always just brushed it off. Until one day the service was completely unacceptable and the server was extremely rude. The whole experience was really bad I decided I would not be tipping that night. I have never done this before although I have never had such bad experience either. The server notice this and said if you don't tip don't come back again and started yelling in another language. I will definitely not be returning. That is not how you treat your customers.

kzIVAXPZXQquAx7rH-MAcg.text: Staff was terrible. Literally got every one of our orders wrong on our table, didn't bring us chopsticks nor silverware and when someone asked them where the chopsticks were and he would get them if they're too busy (they weren't) they rolled their eyes so hard!! Theeeen, when all the bills came, some of us like to pay with card and then leave a cash tip so, we lined through the "tip line" the server says, "No, that's where you put the tip on that line." Dude, if we don't want to tip you for your awful and rude service, we don't have to!! Shameless. Trying to guilt patrons into tipping. First of all, we had multiple checks on the same table so, we had worked out who would be tipping and who wouldn't bc of how we had already worked it. Don't be so disrespectful to demand and guilt a tip when you got everything wrong on our table, food arrived way later than other parts of the table, and you couldn't even be bothered to bring us chopsticks. This place was terrible and the food was sub par at best.

AMQGZEEh5GaSptwR4R9OQA.text: In the midst of one of the worst parking lots, this is a great find, especially on this side of town. Happy hour lasts until 7p so you can wash away your stresses and woes. There's even sushi on the happy hour menu to go with your Tsing Tao. Staff is incredibly funny and willing to serve you whatever you order. I prefer to sit at the bar and be entertained. My go-to dish is the house lo mein and house fried rice. You should always order the crab rangoons, chicken dumplings (fried), coconut shrimp, and the beef satay. Servings are pretty plentiful. I must say, the coconut boba is the bomb. You really can't go wrong with any of the menu item. Come back often, come back a lot. Or just do take out since they offer online ordering!

2ckK75nxO1pTJvSYEb8yBg.text: This negative 1 star review is based on my experience this weekend with the delivery driver. I ordered online like I've done in the past. When checking out there is a tip option, I prefer to give my tips upon arrival. What if my order was wrong? What if they were over an hour late? So I always give tips when I receive my food. When the food was dropped off, the first thing out of the lady's mouth when I opened the door was "You no left tip" Wow, I wasn't ready for that. Not even a "Hello". I told her my reasoning and that I planning on giving a cash tip but that it's really rude to ask for a tip. She didn't care, she said it again, this time more aggressive.. "You didn't leave tip" So I reached into my wallet and handed her a $1. I was planning on giving 25% from my $50 dinner but I was so offended that she was trying to shame me that she lost out on her tip, and because of her, they also lost my business. It's not like I can't find another Chinese delivery option near me.

p4I-isjInRkJt751PWOTjw.text: If you're desperate for some asian food and have time to wait....eat here. Staff is rude and seemed to make customers a inconvenience.Food is mediocre. Wait to be seated is pretty fast, but to get served and checked out takes a while. So bring a book. Greasy, fried, soggy food. Got the orange chicken and was disappointed. Had upset stomach. Such a bummer. Won't suggest anyone to go.

auHFQA3enM4lWmoJ_-7nnw.text: This is my fave place to get sushi right now! All of the rolls we've tried have been spectacular and exceptionally fresh. The restaurant is clean and the atmosphere is calm and peaceful. I will definitely continue to come back.

4MANOwJNxrosHpvBD4gq4Q.text: As always amazing food. NEVER disappointed with my Shrimp Lo Mein, or my Shrimp fried rice. They are always fresh. Amazing quality food for a reasonable price.

xSdNZuYduKAgzsAtyRsoqA.text: This is one of the best places we have tried since moving to Phoenix last year. I have had the Orange Chicken before as take out but tonight the family and I all went inside and sat down. Our waiter was great, our food was great and the prices were amazing! Great date night or family dinner place! I had a roll tonight, the kids had Orange Chicken and my husband had Kung Pao Chicken and all was amazing!

0qHOblOLnnE6hAALnz51OA.text: Food is always good and exactly like I like it..Don't like the low reviews derail you food is fantastic.

S58MTEQGTXsGIF9ayzx_2w.text: Thank God for these people! They kept me fed for the three years I lived in south Phoenix. =)  The staff are super friendly. Everything's good there, though I'm especially fond of the mongolian beef, kung pao chicken and maki rolls.   Lunch specials are great, around $6-$7 for a good amount of great food.  Delivery is fast, and the guy that usually does it is soooo friendly! I wish I could remember his name to give a shout-out.

B1fiziXlD9q94rNBhBJiAg.text: Friendly staff, love their egg drop soup! I have been coming here for the past 10years+. I also love to order their pad thai that has a good amount of kick and crunch with the peanuts. Mangollian beef is so tender and has a perfect sweet sauce. I can go on and on about their variety of menu selections!

xU12VGP0HYjuulkg-DxCMA.text: Had the chicken fried rice this afternoon and since then had stomach ache and diarrhea. Also feel drowsy, it could be the MSG that's added but even the food was served cold and tasteless. I don't think I will be having Chinese food anytime sooner, not going back, need to put this out of my memory.

DnH0TEerBXCo_eWD8-D9xQ.text: I really love this place. It's right down the street from my house and I've been coming here for about 4 years. The staff recognizes my family and they are always super, super nice and attentive. The happy hour menu is great, and happy hour runs 3-7 and after 9pm.

hcuXPbzEOYNK2ztCtXbXbQ.text: Fresh, good Chinese food- Firecracker Shrimp is delish!  Egg rolls are good too- we'll be coming back!

yi7g-84VdsVVuiWBh2JFtw.text: Nice, relaxing ambiance to this place. They serve great vegetable egg rolls and a delicious egg drop soup. I love the hot tea they serve with your meal. The dish I most order here is their Mongolian beef, which is outstanding. The sauce is excellent, and I love having the green onions combined with the very tender, juicy cuts of beef. Unfortunately, my love for their Mongolian beef has kept me choosing this dish over trying some of their others, which means I need to enlarge my dining experience here. I have had their kung pao veggies and did not enjoy it as much as I like Autumn Court's version of the dish. But Sun Asian is an enjoyable place, especially for lunch, and the service is very attentive.

VG4JB7erOI_fOLrZIlSeHw.text: Sun Asian Kitchen is a great restaurant. The place is always clean, the staff is super friendly and attentive, the food is damn good and happy hour is 3-7pm every day with some great specials for sushi, appetizers and drinks. I am a regular here and I can't praise them enough. I have never had a bad experience here. If this is your first time, I'd recommend their spicy tuna rolls... delicious! ^_^

mS-eBI4q0AIizbdJkqcbtQ.text: Was rushed in ordering our food, the food came out and was cold and she just threw our plates down like she was in a rush when the restaurant wasn't full at all. After we had our food the waitress NEVER came back to fill our drinks or check and see how our food was.  We waited forever for the check, our waitress went to other tables and didn't even pay attention to us and as I said before the place was not even half full.   We didn't believe she deserved a big tip so we left her $2 and as we were getting up to go she stopped us and demanded to have a bigger tip than what we left, being frustrated we left her a $5. Will never be going to this place again.

BDclYLpLP35pEp3oQBXQiw.text: I LOVED this place the first time I went.  It was slow, atmosphere was nice.  Waiters were polite.  Then... I went back on a busy day.  I ordered the same thing (sweet and sour pork) and it was like I went to a totally different place.  The food wasn't 'bad', just different.  The flavor was off, the color of the sauce was lighter, and the breading was so tough I almost sent flying a piece of pork my fork couldn't quite pierce through.  Everyone was still polite and all but I can't give this place five stars if it isn't consistent.   I guess I will be sticking to their slow hours to get the quality I got the first time round.

HCvfcne92BLuXjZMRMUMzQ.text: We are regular's at this place and always enjoy the orange chicken and their amazing crispy honey chicken.  The food is always fresh and the staff are friendly.  Highly recommend!!

l66Ju_0MQhV7PNMp2AVJcA.text: I first have to say that the veggie eggroll is awesome! Very few asian spots make good eggrolls. Try it!  A friend and I met here for lunch one day, it was our first time there for the both of us, and we were presently surprised with the affordable lunch specials and quick service.   Besides the eggroll I was raving about, the food was good. Lunch portions were decent, so the value of your dollar is good here.

MocCuLoqOLwbNthZF_rGcw.text: A-mazing Soups, happy-hour appetizers and such cheap pricing! We go here pretty much once a week since its so close to where we live.. Kung-pao chicken and hot  sour soup are the best!  Definitely try it out once and you'll keep coming back!

pe8F9DLQZrsOzpXxOimsHA.text: I'm a regular at this restaurant, this place is amazing!  I always get their orange chicken and their honey walnut shrimp.

N5Mhmi5I_3b8rc_ubPT97g.text: I have been here 3x with the wife. The lunch specials are awesome as well as the food. The food is very reasonably priced. The service is great and fast. Nice atmosphere and clean. It's our favorite Chinese restaurant in Az. Try it you will not be disappointed.

nSvgGLYzU85DeHUdqDC0LA.text: Had the spicy tuna and spicy salmon roll, both were good, not great. The orange chicken was average. Not spiced insided. Looked and tasted as if from frozen. Overall it was good, not great.

D_FKWREHXc8NJc4Fj-ZHTA.text: It's OK.  Not great.  But OK.  Especially if you live in the South Mountain area where we don't have many selections of restaurants to choose from.   My favorite is the Honey Seared Chicken.   They also have a great kids menu if you have adventurous eaters like my 11 year old son.  The service is ....um....efficient...yeah....efficient... but not especially friendly.   They do have an outdoor patio which is a nice addition in the fall.

QWwVxmYWU4ngMOlGOeB3UA.text: Always the same, good food and good service.  Nice to be able To count on repeats being the same.

TGD74w6ccgTVWxC5Fj2QzA.text: Until we discovered Sun Asian, we were going to Pan Asia down the street. Sun Asian is fast, friendly, and has GREAT food. They are very attentive and friendly. They always have our lunches out quickly as they are conscious of our time crunch. Very good lunch specials and much less expensive than the alternative.

PuFp71U5g7sjSfVtskV9hQ.text: My review is soley based on the food, I have only had takeout here I've never dined in. I like Sun Asian, its good for a quick meal for pick up and a better alternative to Panda Express. I really like the honey chicken and the orange chicken, and it comes in a combo which is great.  The crab wontons are my favorite to order, full of cream cheese.  The sushi rolls are good also.

QKf1QG7YZcSpz2y3BH-P3A.text: Called for lunch take-out, ready in 10-15... I ordered the volcano beef lunch combo and a mango slushee with boba. The combo comes with a chicken eggroll and fried or steamed rice. The 3 compartment to-go container had the entree in the largest section, a large scoop of rice and the chicken eggroll in the other 2. The eggroll was not all cabbage, the beef and vegetables were quality and had good flavor. Slushee came in 20 oz. cup. Total bill...8.32----holla!! I will be back, believe dat:-)

14vuNII-GAOnSf6mHC6KHQ.text: I have been there twice for lunch. Both times the food was very good. I had Mongolian Beef and Cashew Chicken.  Both times I felt like we were being rushed. I can see if it's really busy and people are waiting, but in both instances that was not the case.  Sometimes I like to enjoy a leisurely lunch with friends. I don't like to feel I'm being pushed out the door.

cVTOlCISaaDO14MAgAgfCg.text: I've been to Sun Asian before, but that was pre-Yelp. So I was excited to go home and share this experience with all my Yelp friends.   We get to the restaurant just after 11am - it's dead, if the TVs weren't on I could have heard chirping. We got seated, the hostes was very nice and took our order right away. Not even 2 minutes had passed when she brought out our meal...wow, what service. I orderd the Orange Chicken and enjoyed the texture and taste. The chicken meat was tender and the batter was crisp.   Enjoyed my meal and would come again!

YPJCbZmldsQKL1Gz7YYH6g.text: Okay okay... let me be real with ya'll. I DID read the SoMo review back in the day when it first came out. Now, I had my Bay Area hopes & dreams and yeah - was a little disappoitned. But for real. It's a nice place. I hate it when reviews hype a place up only to be disappoitned because it wasn't cracked up to what it was supposed to be even though what it was - was actually really nice.   With that said. This is by FAR the nicest chinese resturant in this area! For real... show me a place that is more authentic AND more clean AND has better service THAT is in the South Mountain area. If you can... I'll give u $20!   If you do decide to go, you MUST try the Won Ton Soup! I love everything, the single shrimp that's always perfectly cooked with the aromatic broth with the stuffed won tons. It's my version of heaven. I always go here for the soup.   Some other favorite dishes are the Hunan chicken which has the right amount of spice and the baby corn is to die for! If you're not too adventerous then the Sweet & Sour is also good as is the Beef & Broccoli. I TOTALLY dig the Mongolian Beef which was suggested to me by a very friendly server.   I am so inlove with the decor and the teal plates and matching salt & pepper shakers and soy sauce pourer and platters. But as a big girl, I must admit... the chairs could be a lil more sterdier. I'm always scared that this is going to be the time I finally brake a chair! The menus are hard to read because of the frosty page covers. I always press the hazy plastic page protectors firmly over the paper and that usually makes it easier to read.   But all in all, it's a very nice place. I have taken quite a few of my friends there and have become somewhat of a regular. I have yet to finish a cup of water and soda because the servers are so attentative that they bring a fresh cup before my first one was even gone! The servers have always been willing to take special orders for me and are always willing to chime in on what they think the best dish is (when asked). I really love this place! :)

8VyGlP_LmBMrNUJjRqzYQQ.text: I grew up on the east coast (outside of Boston) where i feel like the chinese restaurants were a place to get great food as well as a community hang out that served great drinks.   Sun Asian kitchen serves great food and drinks at amazing prices, served by amazing people, in our amazing community. Happy hour is from 3-7 every day with sushi options, apetizers, cocktails, sake bombers, etc...   Whether you want to have a date night and have drinks at the bar, have a family party, or enjoy the patio with the misters to keep you cool, it is tough to beat sun asian kitchen. I love this restaurant and the people that work there.

JIYjSTE2ZIp7mEQIc2ME4A.text: We went here to try some Asian, Chinese food nearby. This place came up and we weren't too picky because we were really hungry.   First, we came in and were greeted by this lady that seem to lack a bit of optimism seeing us (probably had a long time at work). We sat down and got our menus really quick. Our waiter came right when we got seated and got us our waters.  Our waiter was nice...but forceful. He was nice with giving us time to look at the menu. When he served our food, he kept referencing that "ladies should always get their meals here." I'm alright with it but he kept saying it a lot which end up bugging us.   Our food were huge! Really good price for what we get, but the flavor was okay. We weren't too wowed and it was too much that we had to take it to go. I order the Rock n Roll sushi and it was okay but  I felt it was too much mayonnaise for my liking. When  he asked me if I wanted the sushi boxed and I told him no (I don't bring seafood home because I believe it goes bad the next day). He gave us boxes and our check and asked us why I can't bring the sushi home and what's wrong with it. I already told him the reason but it was frustrating to deal with someone to confront you like that.   I gave this place 3 stars. The food is okay but customer service is the key factor here. It's fine to be nice but not confrontational. I can see myself come back here sometime.

K2TGrbA6TJnclUwaNOwu4g.text: Who needs P.F. Chang? This is our go-to Chinese place in South Mountain! Happy Hour 4-7 = Doable for the working class! HUGE chicken egg rolls are $1 (ask for extra orange sauce - you're welcome). California Roll less than $5. Domestic beer is like $2.25 - where can you get a beer for $2.25? The main entrees, at least everything we have tried, are delicious AND generous! At PFC my wife and I would order three entrees just to make a meal - and no leftovers. We ordered three entrees the first time here and, oh my, we took a TON home! Now it's two entrees and a manageable amount of leftovers!  The Orange Beef is crispy and tasty. The General Tso's Chicken is our other favorite. We love their Lo Mein but you have to stop ordering at some point! Not terribly fancy, wouldn't take a prom date here, but if you want great food, huge servings, and a tiny check, this is your new Asian restaurant!

They were literally hawking you from the distance and as soon as you were done with a plate they came over immediately to confiscate. 1evmgPvvqT8cu6MwHAyZSA.text: So glad we found this place. We moved to area a year ago and not sure how we missed it before. The food was so good. Great service as well. Nice large portions. Excellent flavor. We will definitely be going back to try more.

3VQmHtghsJOWIQq14bg94g.text: Went here today with some friends for lunch and really enjoyed it. I hadn't been to Sun Asian Kitchen in a few years, so I was hoping that the food quality and service were still really good. And it was! There was six of us, but the restaurant was pretty empty, so we got our food pretty quickly. What took the most time was getting the little things like our egg rolls, drink refills, chopsticks, and ginger. Our waitress was very nice though and was moving as fast as possible. I love that the lunch menu was until 3pm and then the happy hour menu started at 3pm. I got their ginger broccoli with chicken and a white peach sangria to finish with the happy hour menu. The ginger broccoli with chicken was delicious, but a little heavy on the syrup. The chicken was super tender and their was a nice mix of vegetables. Also, the price was super good as my total was just $11 and I had leftovers. I plan to eat those leftovers in a little bit here. Also, I may go back and get some more food before I leave! I definitely recommend Sun Asian Kitchen for their delicious and light food!

eimomiGlp4AyLKpyxIVjnw.text: Decent Chinese food rained upon by poor, awkward service. I've been coming here on occasion over the last three years, but I don't eat-in anymore.  I used to dine in really often because it's close by, but I got tired of all the waiting. Each time I went I ended up waiting too long for my food, my drink, the check, etc. Not only that, the employees don't socialize too well with customers. It's hard to discern if they're rude or just don't grasp how badly they're interacting with people, as though smiling might make their face crack. It's a little creepy.  The last time I was there I was waiting 17 minutes for the bill when I had elsewhere to be, so I decided not to dine in anymore as a result. That and the Egg Foo Yung that they make is pretty much an omelet as opposed to a  patty. It was a doubly disappointing experience that night.  Meanwhile, as a Take-Out restaurant they are pretty good. The food is vastly better at Golden Phoenix, but the physical plant of Sun-Asian is pretty nice itself. Actually, it's gorgeous and it has great outdoor seating as well. Not exactly comfortable seating, but aesthetically pleasing.  The sushi is passable and it feels awkwardly forced on the establishment as though it was a measure taken to compete with the nearby Pan-Asia. Their small portions, high prices and poor quantities ensure I'll have my raw fish elsewhere. It has all the practicality of a cat with a calculator; it doesn't add up.  Heh.  They tend to be good with chicken dishes, but aside from an outstanding physical plant with typically poor service they have little else aside from great eggrolls to offer to   Eat in at your own peril and have nothing else planned for your day because they aren't in a hurry to get you the bill. Be safe, do take-out instead.

fKIOIywsMxZyW1toHwsooQ.text: Service is awesome, food is great,excellent happy hour 3-7 and 9 to close. $1.75 bud lights.and a killer happy hour menu

My friend got the chicken and snow peas on the lunch menu as well.  It needed some kick and the chili sauce did the trick. I will definitely be back!

HHm45keRup0u-_p6be8YIQ.text: I'm originally from NYC and I've been in Arizona for almost 23 years and still searching for a good Chinese restaurant. I may have found it tonight when we visited Sun Asian Kitchen.  At first glance the outside is in a strip mall, with a pretty patio on the side where you can dine. Walking inside the first thing you see is a bar, and it must have been happy hour because all seats were filled.  We were quickly greeted by a young lady dressed in an Asian top, but her arms were covered with tattoos that were very noticeable and that didn't look very nice (and I am a fan of tats).  Dining room is a little cramped but nice decor, typical Asian style. We asked for a booth and were seated in a small two person booth (I didn't see any larger booths) which was also a bit cramped.  I ordered a cup of wonton soup and we then ordered Roast Pork Egg Foo Young and Orange Chicken. The wonton soup came out very quickly and it was boiling hot, which I really liked since it was a chilly night. The wonton soup was very flavorrful, although quite salty, but it was full of fresh veggies like carrots, bok choy, water chestnuts and scallions. It had three delicious wontons in it and a jumbo shrimp. I have to say that it was some of the best wonton soup I've had since I've been in Arizona and the "cup" would have been enough for a meal for me. It was delicious.  Our food came out before I was done with my wonton soup, but it looked and smelled very good and it was very hot and fresh. My fiancee had the Orange Chicken and he enjoyed it so much that he finished the whole dish. I tasted it and it was so good that I might order it next time. It was tender white meat chicken that was deep fried and in a slightly spicy orange glazed sauce with a hint of soy sauce. It wasn't an over powering flavor of orange and the sauce wasn't overwhelming at all. I can't eat spicy foods and this had just the right amount of spice to it.  My Roast Pork Egg Foo Young was again, filled with fresh veggies and sliced twice cooked roast pork which was very tasty. There was so much that I couldn't even finish have the dish. The egg foo young was in a patty underneath the topping of roast pork and veggies and it was really delicious.  Service was prompt and friendly.   This restaurant is a gem and we'll definitely be back!

wm3BAkH5jONeml6b9_H7Yw.text: Food was decent.  Customizing an order is challenging over the phone.  Brought wrong sushi roll, and when asked to replace the roll, offered only to change the fish that sat on top instead of the entire roll. Not very knowledgable of what good customer service means.  As the community develops I hope this restaurant has more competition so service will improve.

DjpcYYGuUNZ_yF0d4vVvnw.text: Sushi is Very fishy! Avoid it! Staff is not very friendly. Overall experience disappointing.

rzNeVKx1NsK-BQD18J4Pig.text: Visiting from out of state. Hands down the worst service I have ever experienced at a restaurant in my life. Took forever to take our order and then a very long time to bring our food. The wait staff were frantic and running around all over the restaurant like chicken's with their heads cut off. I ordered sushi and specifically asked for no eel or eel sauce and both of my rolls came at two different times covered in eel sauce. The menu didn't even say that the food came with eel sauce. I'm at a loss for words. Maybe this was an anomaly but I won't be returning.

yrUJxHNg4vRGB8FLrH9mOQ.text: Food portions were large and hot. I ordered pick up and they gave me a reasonable time for my food to be ready. The price for four items, came out to be a little more than $35. But in the south mountain area there aren't many other Chinese restaurants better.

3gTXMtkBsdJ9D1ckdSrlDQ.text: I have eaten here a few times. Never had any major issues to stay away. The service was good. Great food and cool atmosphere. My only reason I am not giving 5 stars, is because I asked for hot tea and never got it. Sushi, teriyaki chicken and won ton soup was delicious. I also enjoy their happy hour! I will come again!

72ecFvJND5SeuHAExY9wnw.text: Wish I could leave less then 1 star.  I was looking forward to some Asian food and a nice drink but sat for 30 minutes with no service.  Didn't even get water.  Would not recommend if you are used to tipping extremely well for good service.  There loss!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sun Asian Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

m8XTYePUA7tdunAzxPIkpg.text: On 3/3/15,My family and I went to eat at Sun Asian Kitchen, this is not my first time eating here, nor my family's first time. My food was good , service was good, but cleanliness, not so good, and the Sushi was fresh but HORRIBLY PREPARED. Also,  I hate restaurants with fake plants. If you have the fake plants please clean the whole plant not just the part you think your customers can see. The table next to us found a, cockroach in their drink. YES, A COCKROACH and then they did not want to refund their dinner, just comp the drink. HORRIBLE    The sushi was good and fresh... but the rolls were loose, which caused the rice to fall off the roll. Who ever is creating the recipes for the rolls needs to be fired. The Teriyaki chicken roll and shogun beef roll needs to be discontinued or redone. There was no visual appeal to the sushi besides it looking fresh, no garnish to add color or different textures to the sushi.  So I will not be visiting SUN ASIAN KITCHEN, NO MORE, YOU LOST ME WITH THE COCKROACH...

cjZUtbf6L9Vf1WzXriiGOg.text: Food 4/5: I've been to this place a few times for lunch. Always have eaten off of their Chinese menu never went for the sushi. Tonight I tried their sushi. Wasn't bad but want anything spectacular at all. Wish I got the Kung pao chicken instead. Go here for the Chinese not the sushi  Service 4/5: these people work really hard. They Don't seem to be organized which affected how long it took the good to arrive but they are always working hard so for ME it's hard to say anything bad.

vphda4nHJSAVyQ1pwFEFaA.text: My bf and I have been here multiple times and every single thing we have gotten off the menu has been nothing but delicious!  The sushi is very good! Tastes fresh! Hot and sour soup is amazing!  You cannot beat how good the food is and the pricing is exceptional!

16Z0Lk6PbGJYJeiQk_Es1g.text: Great happy hour prices with a good size happy hour menu. The food is average, but on the cheaper side as well. If you want good sushi on a budget, this is your place. Avocado boats and Philly rolls are my favorite here. They do have most of your typical Asian cuisine as well. Ambiance is nice, casual dining, good for groups, kid friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Sun Asian Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. I have no idea guys.......

Photo of Sun Asian Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Happy Hour menu...

PylGMS08_cl88kMwdyF9Qw.text: in 2012 i used to work near here and this was one of our lunch spots.  This place is a bargain.  A+ in customer service. Outdoor patio.  Our meal consisted of: Sake / Saporo  Big bowl of alcohol it was a bit on the weak side, I couldn't really taste the alcohol or the sugar.  Orange chicken is dripping with sauce. Kung Poa beef is full of rich vegetables however I would've liked a bit more beef. Family size rice bowl. Tuna roll was ok. No fancy presentation just rice covered seaweed stuffed with tuna. bbq pork appetizer was cooked a little too rare for me.   Final tab 42 + tip and 3 happy customers.

DxqzbWSNHxKmM427_riWiA.text: Came in on a weekend for dinner.  I was impressed by the happy hour- decent deals on sake and appetizers (mostly fried delights such as egg rolls and rangoon).  Ordered the crab rangoons (yummy! Loved the sauces too) and the spicy salmon roll (sloppy, not all that appealing).  Shared the General Tso Chicken and fried rice with my husband.  Good fried rice and the breading on the chicken was perfect, but the dish was swimming in sauce.  if you are looking for an average Chinese place and want to have a nice sit-down meal, this is about as good as it gets in South Phx.

hWUSbVgXkpMa8m63CD75NQ.text: This place had HORRIBLE customer service. I had ordered a regular Pepsi and they put lettuce into my Pepsi. For sure won't go here again. Save your money.

9dHp7RcKpUpT6t5CBw2bbw.text: I would give this place 5 stars if their service is consistent, but it's not.    Many places try to be what this place does well, asian fusion. Authentic flavors and good prices.  This is my go to lunch spot.

qoCgBiy-J8yuEIrGCkT0Iw.text: Happy hours is very reasonable and I like the happy hour menu, I'm a picky eater but I have enjoyed their sushi chicken lo mein

64jg_TJwPpJASGXgBtIdMw.text: The worst customer service ever i called to order food over the phone and was hung up on because she didn't understand me tried to call again as i was on lunch and short on time the last time i went the lady ran after me because she lost the reciept i paid for

xzXxjyGxtDcsDs25RCwAPA.text: Sun Asian has won me over! The happy hour runs from 3-7pm and is a smoking good deal. $1 eggrolls, sushi and sashimi, and all other sorts of items all under $5. I love the fired tofu, the beef skewers, the spring rolls and the crab puffs.   They have Kirin Light and sake and wait staff is incredibly friendly. If I lived in the area I would find myself here more often.

APjtH7RKuvs7uXxiuGUW7g.text: Still my favorite Chinese restaurant, especially since they put up with all my picky requests :D  If I could give them more stars I would, but I can't, so I'll settle for giving them more money.

photos.caption: Photo of Sun Asian Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Happy Thursday :)

eJBxttXgEXGOlFjqUm8WCg.text: The staff are always friendly and provide great service.  The happy hour is fantastic, and they have a sushi bar. A few favorite go to menu items include; hot and sour soup, egg drop soup, Spicy Saigon noodles, Kung Pao Tofu, vegetable egg foo young, eel (unagi)roll, spicy tuna roll, dragon roll, and sashimi yellowtail. The quality and taste is always consistently good.

EfOH378-67UvD2wK1kBtBQ.text: Little disappointed I was told they didn't have any sushi so I asked, "Why?" They said, "oh I think the sushi guy is on vacation and the other guy has a day off." I told them I would go back there and make it myself jokingly, so I settled for Chinese and got chicken lo mein. Overall, staff is always friendly and great happy hour when they have sushi.

qVMzxhLnpc7dWDEBc7AFaw.text: I come here 1-2 times a week if not more! I love their Wonton Soup and their Mocha Boba Drinks! The staff is super nice and they always get my order out as fast as possible! Im always satisfied!

kNeXpvWfr9DAM10mQ2Y_ww.text: I'm originally from SF my Asian pallette is pretty tuned in to what's good and what's not this place is by far one of the best mom and pop spots that's I've had the pleasure of eating at. The staff is friendly and the furniture sucks. All of the comforts of an SF dive I use to go to on Church St called The Hong Kong. It closed up a while back. Mr. Chen moved back to China.
